summary: The 'No Official Giveaways Of Taxpayers’ Income to Oppressive Nations Act' (NO GOTION Act) aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to deny certain green energy tax benefits (like those under sections 30C, 40, etc.) to companies connected to specific 'countries of concern'. These countries include China, Russia, Iran, and North Korea. The bill defines 'disqualified company' as those created or controlled by these nations, using existing tax code definitions of control. The amendments apply to taxable years beginning after the date of enactment.
